definitions.definition: Not labelled; having no label.
Any atom, group, or radical substituted for another, or entering a molecule in place of some other part which is removed
(grammar) pro-form
(grammar) The prepositional case.
Of, pertaining to, or of the nature of a preposition.
(grammar) Of the prepositional case.
An exploration of the Moon's surface on foot (by an astronaut).
A dance move in which the dancer slides backwards though the feet move as if walking forwards; the backslide.
A dance style in which the dancer appears to be moving in a low gravity environment.
To walk on the surface of the Moon.
To walk in leaps, like on the Moon or on other low gravity surfaces.
To perform the moonwalk.
To walk in a manner that is similar to the moonwalk dance style; to move while sliding backwards as though the feet move as if one was walking forwards.
Assert again
A sharp, pointed, two-edged surgical instrument used in venesection and for opening abscesses etc.
A small, sterile single-use needle used to draw a drop of blood for testing, as with a glucometer.
An iron bar used for tapping a melting furnace.
A high narrow window, terminating in an arch acutely pointed, often double or triple, common in the first half of the 13th century.
A New World monkey of the genus Callicebus, native to South America, distinguished by their long soft fur.
Mutton bird.
A tree of the southern United States (Cliftonia monophylla) having glossy leaves and racemes of fragrant white flowers succeeded by one-seeded drupes.
Any related tree of the genus Cyrilla.
Often followed by with: to secretly cooperate with another person or persons in order to commit a crime or other wrongdoing; to collude, to conspire.
Of parts of a plant: to be converging or in close contact; to be connivent.
Often followed by at: to pretend to be ignorant of something in order to escape blame; to ignore or overlook a fault deliberately.
To open and close the eyes rapidly; to wink.
That connives; conspiratorial.
A synthetic progestogen used as an active ingredient in some hormonal contraceptives.
The science and engineering of interacting surfaces in relative motion; the study and application of technology using the principles of friction, lubrication and wear.
A taxonomic category below phylum and above class
A particular chemical antiseptic and bacteriostatic.
In an authoritative manner, being worthy of trust.
To shape (fabric, etc.) into a ruff; to adorn (a garment, etc.) with a ruff.
Of a falcon, hawk, etc.: to hit (the prey) without fixing or grabbing hold of it.
To ruffle; to disorder.
Of a bird: to ruffle its feathers.
To boast, to brag.
To speak in a loud and domineering manner; to bluster, to swagger.
To play a trump card to a trick when unable to follow suit (that is, to play a card of the same suit as the previous or leading card).
Especially in the form ruff out: to defeat (a card, etc.) by ruffing, thus establishing the master card in the suit led.
To beat a ruff or ruffle, as on a drum.
Of a drum, etc.: to have a ruff or ruffle beaten on it.
Having a ruff.
To select in advance.
Selected in advance
A small breed of dog developed in Belgium, sometimes used as a watchdog on boats.
A person who combs wool, etc.
A machine that combs wool, etc.
A long, curving wave breaking on the shore.
Serranus cabrilla, the gaper, a fish found in European waters.
A variety of firearm in which the weapon is loaded from the end that discharges the projectile (the muzzle).
The property of being unpleasant or disagreeable.
An unpleasant behaviour, occurrence, etc.
To improve.
To become better; to improve.
To surpass in excellence; to exceed; to excel.
To give advantage to; to support; to advance the interest of.
(with bare infinitive) Should; ought to; need to; must.
definitions.example: The project had better get finished by the current deadline.

definitions.definition: A person with limited mental capacity who can perform tasks and think only like a young child, in medical circles meaning a person who lacks the capacity to develop beyond the mental age of a normal five to seven-year-old child.
A fool, an idiot.
Destitute of strength, whether of body or mind; feeble; impotent; especially, mentally weak.
definitions.example: hospitals for the imbecile and insane

definitions.definition: To dig.
To carve or cut, as letters or figures, on some hard substance; to engrave.
To carve out or give shape to, by cutting with a chisel; to sculpture.
definitions.example: to grave an image

definitions.definition: To impress deeply (on the mind); to fix indelibly.
To entomb; to bury.
To write or delineate on hard substances, by means of incised lines; to practice engraving.
To clean, as a vessel's bottom, of barnacles, grass, etc., and pay it over with pitch — so called because graves or greaves was formerly used for this purpose.
Characterised by a dignified sense of seriousness; not cheerful.
Low in pitch, tone etc.
Serious, in a negative sense; important, formidable.
Influential, important; authoritative.
The act of defiling.
The state of being defiled.
The protection of the interior walls of a fortification from enfilading fire, as by covering them, or by a high parapet on the exposed side.
To mix or combine; often used of metals.
To reduce the purity of by mixing with a less valuable substance.
definitions.example: to alloy gold with silver or copper, or silver with copper

definitions.definition: To impair or debase by mixture.
definitions.example: to alloy pleasure with misfortunes

definitions.definition: To join at the butt, end, or outward extremity; to terminate; to be bounded; to abut.
To strike bluntly, particularly with the head.
To strike bluntly with the head.
definitions.example: Rams butt at other males during mating season.

definitions.definition: Use the word "but".
definitions.example: But me no buts.

definitions.definition: An abuttal; a boundary.
To eat hastily or greedily; to scoff or scarf (often used with up)
definitions.example: He gobbled four hot dogs in three minutes.

definitions.definition: To make the sound of a turkey.
A gathering of elders or leaders in Pakistan or Afghanistan, especially within a tribe.
A freshwater fish of the genus Esox.
Walleye, A species of gamefish, Sander vitreus, native to the Northern U.S. and Canada with pale, reflective eyes.
A wading bird, the dunlin.
The tall slender tower of an Islamic mosque, from which the muezzin recites the adhan (call to prayer).
After a meal, especially after dinner.
A breast
A nipple
A kitten
A sister or girl
A brown alga, of the genus Sargassum, that forms large, floating masses.
Also Sargasso: a confused, tangled mass or situation.
A part of an ocean or sea characterized by floating masses of sargassos, like the Sargasso Sea.
An ombudsman or ombudswoman.
A jerk; a mean or rude person.
The glans penis.
A stupid or useless person.
To become a syndicate.
To put under the control of a group acting as a unit.
(mass media) To release media content through a syndicate to be broadcast or published through multiple outlets.
A phenolic substance, 3,5,4'-trihydroxystilbene, a stilbenoid and phytoalexin, that is found in some fruits and nuts, and in red wine, and is reputed to have some beneficial properties for humans.
Beast, animal.
To develop an idea; to form in the mind; to plan; to devise; to originate.
To understand (someone).
To become pregnant (with).
definitions.example: Assisted procreation can help those trying to conceive.

definitions.definition: The people who live in a town, especially the lower and middle classes.
A small silver coin issued both during the Roman Republic and during the Roman Empire, equal to 10 asses or 4 sesterces.
To cause (someone) pain, suffering or distress.
To strike or cast down; to overthrow.
To make low or humble.
Characterized by a high level of activity or gossip; in a buzz, buzzing.
A chronic or heavy drinker of cheap wine or other alcohol; a drunk or drunkard.
A wine enthusiast; an oenophile.
A hypothetical particle that is the superpartner of the W boson.
The state or quality of being thin.
A giant vine native to South America (especially Banisteriopsis caapi), noted for its psychotropic properties.
definitions.example: 2005, the Amazon forest people would take ayahuasca and enter into that place of Group Mind where they would make decisions for the tribe — Martin Torgoff, Can’t Find My Way Home (Simon & Schuster 2005, p. 414)

definitions.definition: Any of various psychoactive infusions or decoctions prepared from this vine.
A dome-shaped ornamental structure located on top of a larger roof or dome.
A small turret, usually on a hatch of an armoured fighting vehicle.
An upward-projecting mass of plutonic rock extending from a larger batholith.
A solid formed by joining two polygons, one (the base) with twice as many edges as the other, by an alternating band of isosceles triangles and rectangles.
A type of furnace used for smelting.
A small cap over a structure that is shaped like a dome or inverted cup.
definitions.example: the posterior cupola of the cartilaginous nasal capsule

definitions.definition: A small viewing window in the top of the caboose for looking over the train, or the part of the caboose where one looks through this window.
To form or shape in an oblique way; to cause to take an oblique position.
To bias or distort in a particular direction.
definitions.example: A disproportionate number of female subjects in the study group skewed the results.

definitions.definition: To hurl or throw.
To move obliquely; to move sideways, to sidle; to lie obliquely.
To jump back or sideways in fear or surprise; to shy, as a horse.
To look at obliquely; to squint; hence, to look slightingly or suspiciously.
The act of making something skewed; an alteration in a particular direction.
definitions.example: unfair skewings of the evidence

definitions.definition: To have a contrary or opposing effect or force on
To deliberately act in opposition to, to thwart or frustrate
To ransack.
In disrepair or disorder; poorly maintained; lacking upkeep, usually of buildings or vehicles.
definitions.example: He entered the ramshackle bus, and was driven a long distance through very sandy streets to the hotel on the St. Lawrence.

definitions.definition: A synthetic resin derived from a reaction between alcohol and certain acids, used as a base for many laminates, paints and coatings.
The quality of being slow of understanding things; stupidity.
The quality of being uninteresting; boring or irksome.
Lack of interest or excitement.
The lack of visual brilliance; want of sheen.
definitions.example: dullness of autumn

definitions.definition: (of an edge) bluntness.
The quality of not perceiving or kenning things distinctly.
definitions.example: dullness of sight, or of hearing

definitions.definition: Drowsiness.

An argument whose conclusion is supported by two premises, of which one contains the term that is the predicate of the conclusion, and the other contains the term that is the subject of the conclusion; common to both premises is a term that is excluded from the conclusion.
A trick, artifice; an extremely subtle, sophisticated, or deceptive argument; a sophism.
To violently move in a turn or writhe.
To pull or twist violently.
definitions.example: With a surge of adrenaline, she wrenched the car door off and pulled out the injured man.

definitions.definition: To turn aside or deflect.
To slander.
To tighten with or as if with a winch.
To injure (a joint) by pulling or twisting.
definitions.example: Be careful not to wrench your ankle walking along those loose stones!

definitions.definition: To distort from the original meaning.
To thrust a weapon in a twisting motion.
To disarm an opponent by whirling his or her blade away.
To rack with pain.
To deprive by means of a violent pull or twist.
To use the tool known as a wrench.
definitions.example: The plumber wrenched the pipes until they came loose.

definitions.definition: To seize power from another, usually by illegitimate means.
To use and assume the coat of arms of another person.
To take the place rightfully belonging to someone or something else.
To make use of.
Usurpation
A climbing plant which climbs by its shoots growing in a helix around a support (distinct from a vine, which climbs using tendrils or suckers).
Cigarette
To stimulate feelings.
definitions.example: The new building proposals in the village are arousing unneeded discomfort.

definitions.definition: To sexually stimulate.
definitions.example: I can't keep my eyes off the dancer; she arouses me greatly.

definitions.definition: To wake from sleep or stupor.
definitions.example: 1996, Beruga (line translated by Dan Owsen), Terranigma. Nintendo of America.

definitions.definition: An assembly that is assembled with others to form a larger assembly
A potato.
A hole in a sock.
A type of short nut (fastener) threaded on both ends.
Anything short and thick.
A piece of dough boiled in fat.
(usually in the plural) A testicle.
A dagger.
A digging fork with three broad prongs.
A tool, similar to a spade, used for digging out weeds etc.
A barking spud; a long-handled tool for removing bark from logs.
The burrow in the ground where a fox lives.
A small pit dug into the ground as a shelter for protection against enemy fire.
To dig a military foxhole into, or convert into a foxhole by digging.
To drive into a military foxhole.
A point at which reflected or refracted rays of light converge.
definitions.example: The heat of sunlight at the focus of a magnifying glass can easily set dry leaves on fire.

definitions.definition: A point of a conic at which rays reflected from a curve or surface converge.
The fact of the convergence of light on the photographic medium.
definitions.example: Unfortunately, the license plate is out of focus in this image.

definitions.definition: The quality of the convergence of light on the photographic medium.
definitions.example: During this scene, the boy’s face shifts subtly from soft focus into sharp focus.

definitions.definition: Concentration of attention.
definitions.example: I believe I can bring the high degree of focus required for this important job.

definitions.definition: The exact point of where an earthquake occurs, in three dimensions (underneath the epicentre).
definitions.example: The earthquake's focus was at exactly 37 degrees north, 18 degrees south, seventy five meters below the ground.

definitions.definition: The indicator of the currently active element in a user interface.
definitions.example: Text entered at the keyboard or pasted from a clipboard is sent to the component which currently has the focus.

definitions.definition: The most important word or phrase in a sentence or passage, or the one that imparts information.
An object used in casting a magic spell.
(followed by on or upon) To concentrate one's attention.
definitions.example: I have to focus on my work.

definitions.definition: To cause (rays of light, etc) to converge at a single point.
To adjust (a lens, an optical instrument) in order to position an image with respect to the focal plane.
definitions.example: You'll need to focus the microscope carefully in order to capture the full detail of this surface.

definitions.definition: To concentrate one’s attention.
definitions.example: If you're going to beat your competitors, you need to focus.

definitions.definition: To transfer the input focus to (a visual element), so that it receives subsequent input.
definitions.example: The text box won't receive the user's keystrokes unless you explicitly focus it.

definitions.definition: A burn, or injury to the skin or flesh, by hot liquid or steam.
Scaliness; a scabby skin disease.
A Nordic poet of the Viking Age
definitions.example: 1913, Henry Bedford-Jones, Flamehair the Skald: A Tale of the Days of Hardrede, passim.

definitions.definition: To burn with hot liquid.
definitions.example: to scald the hand

definitions.definition: To heat almost to boiling.
definitions.example: Scald the milk until little bubbles form.

definitions.definition: Affected with the scab; scabby.
Paltry; worthless.
A mark or symbol worn on the forehead by Hindus, ornamentally or as an indication of status.
The process of forming into a leaf or leaves.
The process of forming into pages; pagination.
The manner in which the young leaves are disposed within the bud.
The act of beating a metal into a thin plate, leaf, foil, or lamina.
The act of coating with an amalgam of tin foil and quicksilver, as in making looking-glasses.
The enrichment of an opening by means of foils, arranged in trefoils, quatrefoils, etc.; also, one of the ornaments.

The property, possessed by some crystalline rocks, of being divided into plates or layers, due to the cleavage structure of one of the constituents, as mica or hornblende. It may sometimes include slaty structure or cleavage, though the latter is usually independent of any mineral constituent, and transverse to the bedding, it having been produced by pressure.
A set of submanifolds of a given manifold, each of which is of lower dimension than it, but which, taken together, are coextensive with it.
One who attends revels; a partygoer.
A plant that turns so that it faces the sun.
A light purple or violet colour.
The fragrance of heliotrope flowers.
A bloodstone (a variety of quartz).
An instrument, employed in triangulation, that uses a mirror to reflect sunlight toward another, very distant, surveyor.
Light purple or violet.
Keeping one’s face turned toward the sun.
A trench, ravine or narrow channel which was worn by water flow, especially on a hillside.
A small valley.
A drop kerb.
A road drain.
A fielding position on the off side about 30 degrees behind square, between the slips and point; a fielder in such a position
A grooved iron rail or tram plate.
(northern UK) A large knife.
To flow noisily.
To wear away into a gully or gullies.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of eagles; resembling that of an eagle.
definitions.example: Frank's aquiline nose jutted out from underneath his glasses.

definitions.definition: To play aimlessly.
definitions.example: You're fiddling your life away.

definitions.definition: To adjust or manipulate for deception or fraud.
definitions.example: Fred was sacked when the auditors caught him fiddling the books.

definitions.definition: To play traditional tunes on a violin in a non-classical style.
To touch or fidget with something in a restless or nervous way, or tinker with something in an attempt to make minor adjustments or improvements.
